title: Promoting the Arts, the Humanities, and Museum and Library Services

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes a committee to promote and support the arts, humanities, museums, and libraries across the United States. It encourages collaboration between federal agencies to enhance cultural access, equity, education, economic development, and civic engagement through the arts and humanities.
potential_concerns: The broad scope of the committeeâ€™s advisory role might dilute focus and slow decision-making.
Ensuring adequate, sustained funding and resources for arts and humanities programs may be challenging given competing budget priorities.
Measuring the impact of arts and humanities investments on economic development and community well-being could be difficult.
Efforts to advance equity and access risk being perceived as political or exclusionary by some stakeholders.
Coordination among many diverse federal agencies could lead to bureaucratic overlap or inefficiencies.
